abstract: Elementary school students in New York City will be served breakfast in classrooms starting in fall; new program, part of $78.5 billion budget deal, ends 10 years in which students had to arrive early to cafeteria in order to take advantage of free breakfasts.
lead_paragraph: Under the new program, which will begin this fall and ramp up over three years, a free breakfast of protein, a grain, fruit and milk will be served in most elementary school classrooms.

headline.main: New York City Schools to Expand Breakfast Program

snippet: Under the new program, which will begin this fall and ramp up over three years, a free breakfast of protein, a grain, fruit and milk will be served in most elementary school classrooms.
